course_main_structural_unit.address:
Lossi 36
51003 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course consists of following topics: indicators in population analyses, standardisation of data,  table data in population analyses, population projections, seminars about the latest  international literature about population analyses (will be changed every year).
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate rahvastikuprotsesside seaduspärasustest, indikaatoritest ja üldistest tendentsidest maailmas. Põhjalikumalt käsitletakse sündimuse, suremuse, abielukäitumise ja rändega seotut. Kursuse käigus omandatakse enamlevinud rahvastikustatistika näitajate kasutamise ja interpreteerimise oskus.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give a knowledge about demographic processes and their measurement.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda teadmised demograafiliste protsessside olemusest ja mõõtmisest.

learning_outcomes.en:
Those who pass the course are able to
Find information about main demographic indicators and understand the meaning of these indicators
Use and calculate the main demographic indicators
Know and are able to analyse main factors behind fertility changes
Know and are able to analyse main factors behind mortality changes
Know and are able to analyse main factors behind migration changes
Know most essential theories demographic theories and are able to apply them empirically.
learning_outcomes.et:
Kursuse läbinud omandavad oskuse leida informatsiooni peamiste demograafiliste näitajate kohta
Kasutada ja ise arvutada peamisi demograafilisi näitajaid
Teavad ja oskavad analüüsida sündimust mõjutavaid peamisi seaduspärasusi
Teavad ja oskavad analüüsida suremust mõjutavaid peamisi seaduspärasusi
Teavad ja oskavad analüüsida rännet mõjutavaid peamisi seaduspärasusi
Orienteeruvad olulisemates sündimuse, suremuse ja rände teooriates ning oskavaid neid kasutada empiiriliselt.

independent_work.et: Students will fill in a small feedback questions and assignments after every lecture and get relevant points. The instructions and points for those works are listed in Moodle.

grade_evaluation.et: After every lecture the students have a small assignment. Delay of submitting the the assignment on time will lead to reduction of one point per day from the total score. The sum of those works forms 90 points of the final result of the course. Exam will add 30 points.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
Livi-Bacci, M. A Concide History of World Population
Weeks, J. R. Population. an Introduction to Concepts and Issues
Trovato, F. Population and Society
